title: Aryna Sabalenka Wins Tennis Match with Amazing Tie-Break Record
summary: Aryna Sabalenka is a tennis player who won a big match at the Australian Open. She beat Victoria Mboko by winning two sets: 6-1 and 7-6. In the second set, she played a tie-break, which is a special game to decide the set when it's tied. Sabalenka has won 20 tie-breaks in a row at Grand Slam tournaments, which is a new record. She is very good under pressure and doesn't get nervous. Sabalenka will now play against Iva Jovic in the quarter-finals. She has reached the quarter-finals in many Grand Slams in a row and is trying to win the Australian Open again. People like Annabel Croft say her tie-break record is incredible because she stays confident.

background_read: Tennis is a sport where players hit a ball over a net. Grand Slam tournaments are the biggest events in tennis, like the Australian Open. A tie-break is played when a set is tied at 6-6 to decide the winner. Players like Aryna Sabalenka compete to win matches and set records. Confidence helps athletes perform well in tough situations.
Article_Structure: WHO: Aryna Sabalenka, a tennis player from Belarus
WHAT: She won a match and set a new record for consecutive tie-break wins at Grand Slams
WHERE: At the Australian Open on Rod Laver Arena
WHY: To advance to the quarter-finals and continue her success in tennis

perspectives.description: Sabalenka focuses on playing point by point without overthinking to win tie-breaks
Annabel Croft praises Sabalenka's incredible record and ability to handle pressure
